text.text_translated: Having more knowledge of the possible differences in what people expect and how they behave can help us avoid misunderstandings. However, it is very important that we also remember that cultural stereotypes (fixed ideas about how all people from a country or group behave) can seriously damage good business relationships. Although national cultures could play a part in shaping how we behave and think, we are also greatly influenced by the region we come from, the groups of people we spend time with, our age and gender, the way a company works, and our own experiences. Therefore, we should keep the knowledge of these possible differences in mind, rather than using it to put all people from a country into one small group.
